name: Welcome Heritage Ranjit's SVAASA

reviews.text: I recently spent two nights at this hotel with my family (two rooms), loved the old charm feel of the property - was warned that hotels can be cold in the winter but both rooms were well heated and extra blankets were available (but not needed). This hotel is one of a kind - didn't want to stay in one of those business hotels after this.
reviews.title: Fantastic heritage hotel

reviews.text: Very quiet location & pleasant staff
reviews.title: Pleasant stay !

reviews.text: I was here in the month of December 2012. This is a heritage property in main Amritsar city. The location is excellent as it is in Mall road. It is peaceful and not commercialized. The rooms were spacious, clean and well equipped. The beds were very comfortable. The staff also was warm and hospitable. The breakfast was complimentary although they had a small spread. There was one small hitch - the crockery had some kind of pest control smell. Probably their kitchen/store had just undergone pest control treatment at that time. It was good on their part to specially arrange for breakfast for our friends who were leaving early in the morning. This place is highly recommended.
reviews.title: Do Not Stay Here

reviews.text: In June of 2012 I traveled to Amritsar and paid for two nights ($142 per night) at Ranjit's Svaasa ahead of time. It was my worst experience in a five-week trip to India.
reviews.title: Would come back.

reviews.text: I seek out small hotels with character wherever I travel and can say this is the worst so-called Heritage Hotel I have seen. Upon arrival, the staff showed me to an extremely dark, cramped room with one small window in a corner of the hotel. It was uninhabitable. The owner reluctantly agreed to show me the best room in the hotel after I expressed my disappointment. There were no other guests staying at the hotel.
reviews.title: An Option One Must Consider in Amritsar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed for three nights and found the staff to be the hotel's best asset, in particular Susheil (spelling?) who served us numerous cups of tea and coffee. Great guy who is very friendly and knowledgeable. Everyone was very kind when we arrived to a phone message of very sad news.
reviews.title: Nice enough but not a luxury experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The heritage hotel site is a tad faded and is showing the signs of being a grand old lady. The historical artifacts and photos etc are wonderful to browse around but did give off the whiff of being in a country second hand store. The hotel is sited in a good location and we walked the streets enjoyably. Nice to have some fresh air after Dehli!
reviews.title: Potentially lovely hotel, but under reconstruction

reviews.text: As it was winter when we visited the wide cracks between the windows and walls, doors and ceilings did provide a little too much fresh air circulation for comfort. The staff had tried to combat this with three fan heaters and a heat pump on full in the suite but it was a bit of a losing battle. However the most delicious array of weighty, gorgeous and warm velvet and cotton bedclothes kept us toasty when in bed.
reviews.title: Homely Retreat in beautiful Amritsar

reviews.text: The rooms were adequate but in no way could I describe them as luxurious as claimed by their own advertising, the food also was adequate but not inspiring. The delicious cookies provided with each cuppa were a divine bonus.
reviews.title: Pleasant and safe accomadation

reviews.text: The shower unfortunately rarely provided any hot water and never enough to actually get washed let alone warm.
reviews.title: Cozt saty in Amritsar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I should have rated this hotel as poor rather than average were it not for the fact that there is only a limited choice of places to stay in Amritsar. The positives are that it is a genuinely old, middle class, property with some character and the staff are friendly and pretty attentive. The negatives are its location (tucked away down a long alleyway), its shabbiness and food that could most charitably be described as 'adequate'. It could do with some investment to improve the basics of plumbing, heating, electrics etc. and to present the property's vintage as an attraction rather than a detriment.
reviews.title: "Shabby not chic"

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Worst of eleven hotels in our tour. One of those places that rely on package tourists too busy with the sights to complain. We didn't but should have. Large and quiet but gloomy room, comfortable beds, but bathroom smelt strongly and permanently of drains. Electricity and water unreliable, TV didn't work at all, room heater and kettle unsafe. Lots of places to sit out, but shared with the owners' three dogs who roam the corridors and stairways. Old domestic kettles and toasters still in use at chaotic breakfast. No proper restaurant: meals supposed to include roti or poppadom did not, but were still charged full rate. Beer bottles marked to be sold at 55-75 rupees charged at 250, sometimes cold, sometimes not, sometimes unavailable, and to be paid in cash against hand-written bill - no alcohol licence? Much better hotels available - avoid.
reviews.title: More tatty than quirky

reviews.text: I stayed here with my mother twin room, double beds for both. The room was clean, quiet and spacious and not over the top price-wise. Hot water was a little tempremental but we are in India. I have to disagree with other reviews on the food and say that the food for us was good; nothing spectacular but definitely serviceable. Service is a little slow, just relax and enjoy the calm. We had a total of 4 meals in the restaurant area, made better by the fact we could sit outside.
reviews.title: Brilliant Oasis in Amritsar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were served ice cold beer on a really hot day, after wandering the crazy streets of Amritsar and the Goldemn Temple, and relaxed in the calm, green garden. Just what you need as Amritsar is quite full-on (I live in Delhi so I am used to the Indian roads).
reviews.title: Disappointing
The real Breath of Life "Stay with Moghul Style"
reviews.text: The inside is lovely, and there are lots of interesting things to look at.

ranjit`s svassa is among the few best heritage hotels i have visited......giving the feel of a hotel ...still so homely..the room allotted us was classic....extremely romantic interior..and ample space for a 2+2 family...everything has been taken care of by the interior designer...the aroma in the haveli was amazing....would definitely stay here only on my next stay to amritsar..thanx abhimanyu for you guidance...things had been much easier due to that...
reviews.title: unexpectedly beautiful

reviews.text: This was the first heritage hotel of our tour (26 day, 8 people, 5 rooms) and we were disappointed almost all round, having stayed in other heritage properties in other parts of India in the past few years. Rooms all different, but "pot luck" as to quality. The food boring, very limited choice but wine was available at a reasonable price. Management and reception staff very slow and lacking in people skills, other staff very helpful. Overall we did not enjoy our 2 nights, but the Golden Temple was amazing. The Crystal Restaurant, Queens Road is very good and close by.
reviews.title: Heritage Hotel experience
Our home away from home
reviews.text: When we arrived to Amritsar it was around midnight but we were still greeted with a warm smile. Our check in was painless and we also had warm food waiting for us in our room. Honestly our stay at Svassa was excellent. We were treated like family. And the location is a nice retreat away from the noise of the city. Our every request was granted with a smile. If don't like big hotels and want to experience something special then I highly recommend staying here. Every room is unique and special in it own way. And all the guests are made to feel welcome and there's a sense of happiness about the place. The house itself has a rich history and there are portraits and photographs everywhere, it's like a mini museum. Rama and her son Abby take much pride in providing only the best for their guests. We'll miss them very much.

Wonderful colonial family home, welcoming and extremely comfortable. Knowing it was my first visit to Amritsar and too that i was travelling alone the hotel arranged for a car and driver to meet me at the airport.
reviews.title: Beautiful introduction to Amritsar

reviews.text: Nothing has been too much trouble and the family are very much hands on with a strong sense of customer service. Natural, charming and most professional.
reviews.title: Overpriced

aka: Welcome Heritage Ranjit`s Svaasa Hotel Amritsar
